Player History
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1985, off Mario Soto (CIN)...
Earned first career win on 4/3/1985...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 9/1/1985, going 5-0, 2.00...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/10/1986, winning 2 games with a 1.69 ERA...
6/25/1986: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $13,000,000 per year, for 3 years.
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/28/1987, winning 2 games with a 2.12 ERA...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1988...
6/10/1989: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $13,500,000 per year, for 5 years.
Hit first career homerun on 6/15/1989, off Ken Dayley (STL)...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 7/1/1990, going 5-1, 1.64...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Won Cy Young Award in 1990, going 21-8, 2.29 ERA...
Traded from Los Angeles to Toronto on 6/24/1991 (Going to LAD: LF Carl Everett, P Ron Mahay, C Mike Scioscia. Going to TOR: P Orel Hershiser, P Dan Plesac, P Mark Davis)...
Set a new season AL-Record for Strikeouts with 246 on 9/14/1991 ...
Set a new season AL-Record for Strikeouts with 254 on 9/21/1991 ...
Set a new season AL-Record for Strikeouts with 258 on 9/27/1991 ...
Traded from Toronto to Chicago on 2/2/1992 (Going to CHC: P Orel Hershiser. Going to TOR: P Jeff Fassero, 1B Mark Grace)...
Was selected to the 1992 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Chicago in 1992...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/19/1993, winning 2 games with a 1.13 ERA...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 7/1/1993, going 5-1, 1.08...
Was selected to the 1993 Allstar game...
